article.description: — Xaivian Lee scored 27 points as Princeton beat Harvard 66-53 on Friday night.
article.headline: Xaivian Lee's 27 lead Princeton past Harvard 66-53
article.linkText: Xaivian Lee's 27 lead Princeton past Harvard 66-53
article.story: BOSTON -- — Xaivian Lee scored 27 points as Princeton beat Harvard 66-53 on Friday night. Lee added nine rebounds and six assists for the Tigers (20-3, 8-2 Ivy League). Caden Pierce scored 14 points and added 11 rebounds. Dalen Davis shot 2 for 9, including 2 for 6 from beyond the arc to finish with eight points. The Crimson (13-10, 4-6) were led by Tyler Simon, who posted 13 points and seven rebounds. Harvard also got nine points and eight rebounds from Malik Mack. Chisom Okpara also had nine points. Both teams next play Saturday. Princeton visits Dartmouth and Harvard plays Pennsylvania at home. ------ The Associated Press created this story using technology provided by Data Skrive and data from Sportradar.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
